description: CONVEX Reasoning Patterns - Strategic decision-making rules for marketing intelligence system

compression_rules.name: Message Compression Rules
compression_rules.description: Simplify complex concepts into memorable, actionable statements

rules.rule: Simplify first, expand only if needed
rules.principle: Start with core insight, add complexity only to strengthen core message

example.verbose: Our AI-powered contact management system uses machine learning algorithms to analyze communication patterns and behavioral indicators to predict which leads have the highest probability of conversion based on multiple weighted factors including email engagement frequency, response sentiment analysis, interaction recency, and historical transaction data.
example.compressed: AI predicts your hottest leads automatically

rules.application: Always find the one-sentence core value before expanding
rules.metric: If explanation takes >30 seconds, too complex

rules.rule: Bias toward high-conversion action over complexity
rules.principle: Choose messaging that drives action over messaging that demonstrates sophistication

example.sophisticated: Leveraging proprietary algorithms trained on 50M+ interactions
example.conversion_focused: See your best opportunities in 60 seconds

rules.application: Test messaging by asking: Does this make someone want to try it?

rules.rule: Focus on outcome, not product description
rules.principle: Customer buys outcome, not features or methodology

mappings.outcome: Close deals faster with less prospecting
Never miss an opportunity from email
Sales team focuses on selling, not admin

rules.application: Always translate feature → outcome → emotional benefit
rules.metric: Messaging shifts from 'we have X' to 'you achieve Y'

rules.principle: Every word should serve the conversion goal

techniques.ineffective: Our solution typically helps most companies generally improve their processes
Leveraging CRM paradigms for enhanced customer journey orchestration
Might help you possibly improve conversions

rules.application: Edit for clarity as aggressively as clarity
rules.metric: Word count reduction while increasing clarity

rules.principle: Always include numbers, percentages, time metrics

examples.with_anchor: Save 10 hours per week on prospecting
Close 3 deals per week instead of 1
Know customer intent before they call

rules.application: Every benefit statement should include a metric

high_conversion_logic.name: High-Conversion Logic
high_conversion_logic.description: Decision-making framework for maximizing customer acquisition and conversion

rules.rule: Start with the customer's desired outcome
rules.principle: All strategy flows from understanding what customer wants to achieve

process.question: What does success look like for them?

process.action: Identify gaps between current and desired
process.question: What prevents them achieving outcome?

process.message: Save time prospecting → Focus on closing → Hit target
process.alignment: Every message connects back to outcome

rules.application: All messaging, positioning, and offers derive from customer outcome

rules.principle: Sales conversion is removing objections, not adding features

examples: Is it right for our business?

rules.application: Website copy addresses top 5 objections before visitor asks

messaging_framework.example: Built for 10-50 person sales teams closing $100k-1M deals
Average client closes 35% more deals in 90 days
Pays for itself in 3 deals (saves 50 hours at $150/hr)
Direct Slack access to implementation team

rules.application: Every landing page section addresses one objection

rules.principle: Small messaging changes drive big conversion changes

test_framework.test: Action verb + benefit vs. minimal text
Testimonial vs. case study vs. stats

rules.application: A/B test messaging monthly, implement winners

rules.why: If you say same thing as competitor, customer picks based on brand/price
rules.application: If messaging is same as competitor, it's wrong messaging

safety_rules.name: Safety & Compliance Rules
safety_rules.description: Ensure all marketing claims are factual, ethical, and compliant

rules.rule: All claims must be factual and verifiable
rules.principle: Truth Layer validation mandatory before output

requirements.correct: ✅ '85% of users in case study saw results within 90 days'
✅ 'Average client increased sales 35% in 90 days' (with case studies)

rules.audit_process: Every claim >5% benefit needs case study or verification

rules.principle: Compare capabilities fairly, never attack character/motive
allowed: Their approach takes 4 weeks, ours takes 1 week (verifiable)
forbidden: Competitors don't care about customer success
Everyone uses competitor except smart companies
rules.audit_process: Review all competitor comparisons for defamation risk

rules.rule: Avoid fabricating social proof or testimonials

requirements.requirement: All testimonials must be from real customers
Customer counts must be actual users
Case study results must be typical
requirements.example: ❌ Show only outlier results (client with perfect storm)
requirements.correct: ✅ Show range - best case, average case, good results

rules.audit_process: Every testimonial documented with customer permission

requirements.example: Works best for sales teams with 10-50 people and $500k+ annual contracts
Most clients see results within 90 days, some faster/slower
We don't handle customer support tickets - we prepare your team

disclosures.disclosure: Disclose if reviewer receives payment/free access
Disclose if featured company is partner

rules.audit_process: Every recommendation reviewed for undisclosed conflicts

compression_rules_priority: Rule 001: Simplify first - always start here
Rule 003: Focus on outcome - reframe benefits
Rule 005: Anchor in metrics - add numbers
Rule 002: Bias toward action - remove jargon
conversion_rules_priority: Rule 001: Start with customer outcome - foundation
Rule 004: Test and iterate - continuous improvement
Rule 005: Own unique positioning - avoid copy
safety_rules_priority: Rule 001: Verify all claims - mandatory audit
Rule 003: Real proof only - no fabrication

messaging_selection.question_1: What is customer's core desired outcome?
messaging_selection.if_unclear: STOP - Go interview customers before proceeding
messaging_selection.question_2: What prevents them from achieving outcome?
messaging_selection.question_3: How does our solution uniquely close that gap?
messaging_selection.output: Positioning statement that compresses to one sentence

claim_validation.question_3: Is this owned position or competitor claim?
